tutorialSidebar.label: Projects
tutorialSidebar.description: A collection of my personal and professional projects showcasing my skills and expertise in software development.

guides/cicd-lab/cicd-lab-setup-mac.title: ğŸ” Local CI/CD Lab Environment on M1 Mac
guides/cicd-lab/cicd-lab-setup-mac.description: This document describes the setup of a fully local CI/CD lab environment on an Apple M1 Mac (16GB RAM) using Jenkins, Nexus, SonarQube, GitLab (local), Minikube, and Helm for Kubernetes deployments.

guides/cicd-lab/cicd-lab-setup-ubuntu.title: ğŸ” Local CI/CD Lab Environment on Ubuntu Host
guides/cicd-lab/cicd-lab-setup-ubuntu.description: This document describes the setup of a fully local CI/CD lab environment on an Ubuntu Linux host (22.04/24.04 LTS with 16GB+ RAM) using Jenkins, Nexus, SonarQube, GitLab (local), Minikube, and Helm for Kubernetes deployments.

guides/cicd-lab/cicd-lab-setup-windows.title: ğŸ” Local CI/CD Lab Environment on Windows Host
guides/cicd-lab/cicd-lab-setup-windows.description: This document describes the setup of a fully local CI/CD lab environment on a Windows host (Windows 10/11 Pro or Enterprise with 16GB+ RAM) using Jenkins, Nexus, SonarQube, GitLab (local), Minikube/Docker Desktop, and Helm for Kubernetes deployments.

guides/intro.title: Getting Started
guides/intro.description: Welcome to the Guides section! Here you'll find step-by-step tutorials to help you set up and work with various projects.

guides/monitoring/grafana.title: ğŸ“ˆ Grafana
guides/monitoring/grafana.description: Grafana is an open-source platform for monitoring and visualization that visualizes data from various sources such as Prometheus, Elasticsearch, MySQL, PostgreSQL, and many others.

guides/monitoring/logstash.title: ğŸ“‹ Logstash
guides/monitoring/logstash.description: Logstash is an open-source data processing pipeline tool from the ELK Stack that collects, transforms, and forwards data from various sources to Elasticsearch or other destinations.

guides/monitoring/nagios.title: ğŸ‘ï¸ Nagios
guides/monitoring/nagios.description: Nagios is an open-source monitoring system that monitors IT infrastructures, controls services, servers, networks, and applications, and sends alerts in case of problems.

guides/monitoring/prometheus.title: ğŸ“Š Prometheus
guides/monitoring/prometheus.description: Prometheus is an open-source monitoring and alerting system specialized in metrics and time-series data. It collects, stores, and analyzes metrics from servers, applications, and network devices.

intro.title: ğŸ“– Documentation
intro.description: This documentation is divided into three main sections:

knowledge-base/cheat-sheets/aws-cli-comm.title: â˜ï¸ AWS CLI Commands
knowledge-base/cheat-sheets/aws-cli-comm.description: A comprehensive reference of the most important AWS CLI commands for cloud administrators and DevOps engineers.

knowledge-base/cheat-sheets/azure-cli-co.title: â˜ï¸ Azure CLI Commands
knowledge-base/cheat-sheets/azure-cli-co.description: Comprehensive reference for the most commonly used Azure CLI (az) commands.

knowledge-base/cheat-sheets/gcloud-cli-c.title: â˜ï¸ Google Cloud CLI Commands
knowledge-base/cheat-sheets/gcloud-cli-c.description: Comprehensive reference for the most commonly used Google Cloud CLI (gcloud) commands for cloud administrators and developers.

knowledge-base/cheat-sheets/linux-comman.title: ğŸ§ Linux Shell Commands
knowledge-base/cheat-sheets/linux-comman.description: Comprehensive reference for the most commonly used Linux commands for system administration across different distributions.

knowledge-base/dataformats/json.title: ğŸ“„ JSON
knowledge-base/dataformats/json.description: Brief developer practice (parsing, tools, APIs, streaming) and security aspects (validation, injection, logging for security). The goal is a practical, actionable reference.

knowledge-base/dataformats/yaml.title: ğŸ“ YAML
knowledge-base/dataformats/yaml.description: Brief: YAML (YAML Ain't Markup Language) is a human-readable data serialization format often used for configuration files, deployment manifests (e.g., Kubernetes), CI/CD pipelines, and data transfer. This guide covers basics, advanced features, best practices, security aspects, and concrete examples from practical contexts like Kubernetes, Helm, and CI.

knowledge-base/devops.title: âš™ï¸ DevOps Engineer
knowledge-base/devops.description: DevOps is a culture, an approach, and a practice that connects software development (Dev) and IT operations (Ops).

knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/aws-codepipe.title: â˜ï¸ AWS CodePipeline
knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/aws-codepipe.description: AWS CodePipeline is a fully managed CI/CD service that automates build, test, and deployment processes. Combined with other AWS services like CodeCommit, CodeBuild, CodeDeploy, and CodeArtifact, it creates a complete native AWS solution.

knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/azure-devops.title: â˜ï¸ Azure DevOps Pipelines
knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/azure-devops.description: Azure DevOps Pipelines is a comprehensive CI/CD service that enables automated building, testing, and deployment of applications to any platform. It supports both YAML-based and classic visual pipeline configurations.

knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/bamboo-cicd.title: ğŸ‹ Atlassian Bamboo CI/CD
knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/bamboo-cicd.description: Atlassian Bamboo is a continuous integration and deployment server that seamlessly integrates with other Atlassian products like Jira, Bitbucket, and Confluence. This guide covers the complete setup and usage of Bamboo for CI/CD workflows.

knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/docker.title: ğŸ³ Docker
knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/docker.description: Short: This text provides a practical and comprehensive guide to Docker, Docker Compose and Docker Swarm. It covers basics, installation, Dockerfile details (including RUN, CMD, ENTRYPOINT), Compose files, Swarm stacks, Buildx (multi-arch), Docker-in-Docker (DinD), volumes, networks, registries (public & private), build arguments, secrets, Multi-Stage builds, best practices and cheat-sheets. Figures are referenced (./images/...) but are not included in this archive.

knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/gcp-cloud-bu.title: â˜ï¸ Google Cloud Build & Deploy
knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/gcp-cloud-bu.description: Google Cloud Platform offers a comprehensive suite of CI/CD tools including Cloud Build, Cloud Source Repositories, Cloud Deploy, and Artifact Registry. This guide covers the complete native GCP CI/CD solution.

knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/github-actio.title: ğŸ™ GitHub Actions
knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/github-actio.description: GitHub Actions is a powerful CI/CD platform integrated directly into GitHub repositories. It enables automation of build, test, and deployment workflows through YAML configuration files stored in .github/workflows/.

knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/gitlab.title: ğŸ¦Š GitLab
knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/gitlab.description: GitLab is a web-based DevOps platform that integrates version control, CI/CD, issue tracking, code review, and container registry.

knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/gitlab-cicd.title: ğŸ¦Š GitLab CI/CD
knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/gitlab-cicd.description: GitLab CI/CD is a powerful, integrated continuous integration and continuous deployment platform built directly into GitLab. It enables automated building, testing, and deployment of applications through pipeline configurations defined in .gitlab-ci.yml files.

knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/gitops.title: ğŸ”„ GitOps
knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/gitops.description: GitOps is an approach to manage cloud infrastructure and applications in a declarative, version-controlled, and automated way.

knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/jenkins-cicd.title: ğŸ”§ Jenkins CI/CD
knowledge-base/devops/ci-cd/jenkins-cicd.description: Jenkins is the leading open-source automation server that enables developers to build, test, and deploy their software reliably. This comprehensive guide covers everything from installation to advanced pipeline configurations.

knowledge-base/devops/devsecops.title: ğŸ”’ DevSecOps
knowledge-base/devops/devsecops.description: DevSecOps is the evolution of DevOps, where security is integrated into all phases of the software lifecycle.

knowledge-base/infrastructure/git.title: ğŸŒ¿ Git â€“ Fundamentals
knowledge-base/infrastructure/git.description: Git is a distributed version control system (VCS) that allows developers to:

knowledge-base/infrastructure/linux/json.title: ğŸ“„ jq Command
knowledge-base/infrastructure/linux/json.description: Brief: jq is a powerful command-line tool for parsing, filtering, transforming, and formatting JSON data. It is particularly useful for logs, APIs, NDJSON, and complex JSON structures. This guide covers the basics through advanced topics and best practices.

knowledge-base/infrastructure/linux/user.title: ğŸ§ User Permissions
knowledge-base/infrastructure/linux/user.description: In Linux, user permissions are managed through users, groups, and file permissions. Each object (file, directory) has an owner, a group, and permissions for "others" (everyone else).

knowledge-base/intro.title: Getting started
knowledge-base/intro.description: Learn the most important Knowledge Base concepts from the sections below.

knowledge-base/network/dhcp-protocol.title: ğŸŒ DHCP
knowledge-base/network/dhcp-protocol.description: DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) is a network protocol that automatically assigns clients IP addresses and other network information.

knowledge-base/network/dns-domain-name-s.title: ğŸŒ DNS
knowledge-base/network/dns-domain-name-s.description: DNS (Domain Name System) is a distributed, hierarchical system that resolves domain names (e.g., example.com) to IP addresses (e.g., 93.184.216.34) and vice versa.

knowledge-base/network/iso-osi-model.title: ğŸŒ ISO/OSI Model
knowledge-base/network/iso-osi-model.description: The ISO/OSI model is a layered model for networks that explains how data is transmitted between two computers. It helps understand which tasks occur at which level in the network.

knowledge-base/network/ssh-secure-shell.title: ğŸš SSH
knowledge-base/network/ssh-secure-shell.description: SSH (Secure Shell) is a protocol that allows you to securely access a remote computer. It encrypts the connection so that no one can intercept your data or passwords.

knowledge-base/network/ssl-tls-encryptio.title: ğŸŒ SSL/TLS
knowledge-base/network/ssl-tls-encryptio.description: SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) and TLS (Transport Layer Security) are protocols that enable secure connections on the internet. TLS is the more modern successor to SSL and is almost always used today.

knowledge-base/network/tcp-three-way-han.title: ğŸŒ TCP 3-Way Handshake
knowledge-base/network/tcp-three-way-han.description: Before two computers exchange data over TCP, they perform a 3-way handshake. This ensures that:

knowledge-base/programming/buildtools/gr.title: â˜• Gradle
knowledge-base/programming/buildtools/gr.description: Gradle is an open-source build tool specialized in automating build processes for software projects. It supports Java, Kotlin, Groovy, Android, C/C++, and many other languages.

knowledge-base/programming/buildtools/ma.title: â˜• Maven
knowledge-base/programming/buildtools/ma.description: Apache Maven is a build and project management tool for Java projects.

knowledge-base/programming/buildtools/ma.title: â˜• Multi-Module Maven Project with Parent-POM

knowledge-base/programming/frameworks/dj.title: ğŸ Django
knowledge-base/programming/frameworks/dj.description: Django basics, apps, models, views, templates, forms, static files, settings, auth, logging, and deployment

knowledge-base/programming/frameworks/fl.title: ğŸ Flask
knowledge-base/programming/frameworks/fl.description: Flask basics, templates, forms, sessions, configuration, dev/prod setup, databases, security, and modularization.

knowledge-base/programming/languages/bas.title: ğŸš Bash Scripting
knowledge-base/programming/languages/bas.description: Bash (Bourne Again SHell) is the default shell in most Linux and macOS systems.

knowledge-base/programming/languages/go.title: ğŸ¹ Go (GoLang)
knowledge-base/programming/languages/go.description: Go (or Golang) is a modern programming language developed by Google that is particularly suitable for DevOps tasks.

knowledge-base/programming/languages/gro.title: ğŸ“ Groovy
knowledge-base/programming/languages/gro.description: Groovy is a dynamic programming language for the JVM that is closely compatible with Java but offers shorter syntax, closures, meta-programming, and DSL support.

knowledge-base/tools/nmap.title: ğŸ” Nmap
knowledge-base/tools/nmap.description: Important / Legal & Ethics: Use Nmap only for systems you have explicit permission to scan (your own infrastructure, test/lab networks, or written authorization). Unauthorized network scans can be illegal and cause operational damage. This guide explains concepts, useful commands for legitimate testing, and security considerations â€” not a guide for misuse.

projects/babytools.title: Baby Tools Shop
projects/babytools.description: The goal of this project is to containerize a Django app. This includes creation of a virtual Python environment in the Docker container and creation of a Django superuser (for admin interface).

projects/challenges/nested-easteregg/nes.description: Apply some advanced cryptanalysis to find the real easter egg.

projects/challenges/visual-geo-stalking/.description: Determine the answer of Emmaâ€™s security question by looking at an upload of her to the Photo Wall and use it to reset her password via the â€Forgot Passwordâ€œ mechanism

projects/challenges/zero-stars-alternati.description: Give a devasting zero-star feedback to the store

projects/conduit.title: Conduit
projects/conduit.description: The goal of this project is to containerize the Conduit application, consisting of an Angular frontend and a Django backend.

projects/conduit-cicd.title: Conduit CI/CD
projects/conduit-cicd.description: This project involves creating a CI/CD workflow (with GitHub Actions) in GitHub, including deployment and execution of a containerized application on a remote server.

projects/juiceshop.description: This repository contains solutions to some of the challenges in the OWASP Juice Shop.
